verses.text: For all this I \w considered|strong="H5414"\w* in my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* even to \w declare|strong="H0952"\w* all this, that the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w*, and the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w*, and their \w works|strong="H5652"\w*, \add are\add* in the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*: no \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* \w either|strong="H1571"\w* \w love|strong="H0160"\w* or \w hatred|strong="H8135"\w* \add by\add* all \add that is\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* them.\f + \fr 9.1 \ft I considered…: Heb. I gave, or, set to my heart\f*

All \add things come\add* alike to all: \add there is\add* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w event|strong="H4745"\w* to the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w*, and to the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*; to the \w good|strong="H2896"\w* and to the \w clean|strong="H2889"\w*, and to the \w unclean|strong="H2931"\w*; to him that \w sacrificeth|strong="H2076"\w*, and to him \w that|strong="H0834"\w* \w sacrificeth|strong="H2076"\w* not: as \add is\add* the \w good|strong="H2896"\w*, so \add is\add* the \w sinner|strong="H2398"\w*; \add and\add* he that \w sweareth|strong="H7650"\w*, as \add he\add* that \w feareth|strong="H3373"\w* an \w oath|strong="H7621"\w*.

This \add is\add* an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* among all \add things\add* that are \w done|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, that \add there is\add* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w event|strong="H4745"\w* unto all: yea, also the \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w men|strong="H0120"\w* is \w full|strong="H4390"\w* of \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*, and \w madness|strong="H1947"\w* \add is\add* in their \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* while they \w live|strong="H2416"\w*, and \w after|strong="H0310"\w* that \add they go\add* to the \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*.

¶ \w For|strong="H4310"\w* to him that \w is|strong="H3426"\w* \w joined|strong="H2266"\w* to all the \w living|strong="H2416"\w* there is \w hope|strong="H0986"\w*: for a \w living|strong="H2416"\w* \w dog|strong="H3611"\w* is \w better|strong="H2896"\w* than a \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* \w lion|strong="H0738"\w*.

For the \w living|strong="H2416"\w* \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that they shall \w die|strong="H4191"\w*: but the \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* \w know|strong="H3045"\w* not any \w thing|strong="H3972"\w*, neither have they any more a \w reward|strong="H7939"\w*; for the \w memory|strong="H2143"\w* of them is \w forgotten|strong="H7911"\w*.

Also their \w love|strong="H0160"\w*, and their \w hatred|strong="H8135"\w*, and their \w envy|strong="H7068"\w*, is \w now|strong="H3528"\w* \w perished|strong="H0006"\w*; neither have they any more a \w portion|strong="H2506"\w* for \w ever|strong="H5769"\w* in any \add thing\add* that is \w done|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*.

¶ Go thy \w way|strong="H3212"\w*, \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* thy \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* with \w joy|strong="H8057"\w*, and \w drink|strong="H8354"\w* thy \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* with a \w merry|strong="H2896"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*; for \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w now|strong="H3528"\w* \w accepteth|strong="H7521"\w* thy \w works|strong="H4639"\w*.
Let thy \w garments|strong="H0899"\w* be \w always|strong="H6256"\w* \w white|strong="H3836"\w*; and let thy \w head|strong="H7218"\w* \w lack|strong="H2637"\w* no \w ointment|strong="H8081"\w*.

\w Live|strong="H2416"\w* \w joyfully|strong="H7200"\w* with the \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* whom thou \w lovest|strong="H0157"\w* all the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of the \w life|strong="H2416"\w* of thy \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*, which he hath \w given|strong="H5414"\w* thee under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, all the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of thy \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*: for that \add is\add* thy \w portion|strong="H2506"\w* in \add this\add* \w life|strong="H2416"\w*, and in thy \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* which thou \w takest|strong="H6001"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*.\f + \fr 9.9 \ft Live…: Heb. See, or, Enjoy life\f*

Whatsoever thy \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* \w findeth|strong="H4672"\w* to \w do|strong="H6213"\w*, \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \add it\add* with thy \w might|strong="H3581"\w*; for \add there is\add* no \w work|strong="H4639"\w*, nor \w device|strong="H2808"\w*, nor \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*, nor \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, in the \w grave|strong="H7585"\w*, whither thou \w goest|strong="H1980"\w*.

¶ I \w returned|strong="H7725"\w*, and \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, that the \w race|strong="H4793"\w* \add is\add* not to the \w swift|strong="H7031"\w*, nor the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* to the \w strong|strong="H1368"\w*, neither yet \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* to the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w*, nor yet \w riches|strong="H6239"\w* to men of \w understanding|strong="H0995"\w*, nor yet \w favour|strong="H2580"\w* to men of \w skill|strong="H3045"\w*; but \w time|strong="H6256"\w* and \w chance|strong="H6294"\w* \w happeneth|strong="H7136"\w* to them all.

For \w man|strong="H0120"\w* also \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* not his \w time|strong="H6256"\w*: as the \w fishes|strong="H1709"\w* that are \w taken|strong="H0270"\w* in an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w net|strong="H4685"\w*, and as the \w birds|strong="H6833"\w* that are \w caught|strong="H0270"\w* in the \w snare|strong="H6341"\w*; \w so|strong="H1992"\w* \add are\add* the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w men|strong="H0120"\w* \w snared|strong="H3369"\w* in an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w time|strong="H6256"\w*, when it \w falleth|strong="H5307"\w* \w suddenly|strong="H6597"\w* upon them.
¶ \w This|strong="H2090"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* have I \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* also under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, and it \add seemed\add* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* unto me:

\add There was\add* a \w little|strong="H6996"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w few|strong="H4592"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* within it; and there \w came|strong="H0935"\w* a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* against it, and \w besieged|strong="H5437"\w* it, and \w built|strong="H1129"\w* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w bulwarks|strong="H4685"\w* against it:

Now there was \w found|strong="H4672"\w* in it a \w poor|strong="H4542"\w* \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w*, and he by his \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \w delivered|strong="H4422"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*; yet no \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \w remembered|strong="H2142"\w* that same \w poor|strong="H4542"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w*.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* I, \w Wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \add is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* than \w strength|strong="H1369"\w*: nevertheless the poor \w man’s|strong="H4542"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \add is\add* \w despised|strong="H0959"\w*, and his \w words|strong="H1697"\w* are not \w heard|strong="H8085"\w*.

The \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add men are\add* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* in \w quiet|strong="H5183"\w* more than the \w cry|strong="H2201"\w* of him that \w ruleth|strong="H4910"\w* among \w fools|strong="H3684"\w*.

\w Wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \add is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* than \w weapons|strong="H3627"\w* of \w war|strong="H7128"\w*: but \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w sinner|strong="H2398"\w* \w destroyeth|strong="H0006"\w* \w much|strong="H7235"\w* \w good|strong="H2896"\w*.
